attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the PM and his Government, to recognise that The Ghurkas are more than entitled to stay in this country and have the same rights as our own troops, pensions etc.
Our reasons are stated below. 

There are many disgraceful events which can be attributed to this awful government but one which I think stands out is their treatment of the Gurkhas.

Today (19-03-2008)many Gurkha war veterens are handing in their medals and as a proud people it is a very sad day for them.

These brave soldiers who are still fighting for Britain...although God knows why......have fought for this country for 200years and yet only those who did so since the nineties are allowed to live in this country.

Their courage and ferocity against the Japanese is legend and in the Falklands war their presence spread terror amongst the Argentinians. A pity they don't have the same effect on this on our illustrious MP's.

They can die for us but they are not allowed to live with us.

What a total disgrace.Britain isn't all that GREAT at times.
